Trial_Design.evidence: a post hoc power analysis was performed for this long-term follow-up study, with survival as the primary outcome.

Participants.evidence: 104 patients were randomized to receive either cementless MoM THA (50 patients) or cementless MoP THA (54 patients).

Intervention.evidence: 104 patients were randomized to receive either cementless MoM THA (50 patients) or cementless MoP THA (54 patients).

Objective.evidence: Questions/purposes: At 10 years of follow-up, (1) what is the difference in survival and revision rates between large-head (38 to 60 mm) MoM THA and conventional 28-mm MoP THA?

Method_Outcome.evidence: the primary endpoint was survivorship free from revision for any cause at the 10-year follow-up interval

Blinding.evidence: Harris Hip Score; the latter was assessed by a blinded nurse practitioner.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 104 patients were randomized to receive either cementless MoM THA (50 patients) or cementless MoP THA (54 patients).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 78% (81 of 104) of patients completed the 10-year postoperative follow-up: 36 patients with MoM THA (72%; six patients lost to follow-up) and 45 with MoP THA (83%; four lost to follow-up).

Harms.evidence: A higher percentage of patients in the MoM group had pseudotumors on CT than those in the MoP group did
